institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Skill Competition Management Rules/Article 35 (Creation and abolition of occupations)
contents: Article 35 (Creation and abolition of occupations) ① When it is necessary to establish a new occupation in international competitions that is not held in domestic competitions, industrial demand, player resources, etc., the president shall consult with the technical advisory committee, etc. After conducting a competition as a demonstration occupation at a competition, it can be newly established as a competition occupation at a domestic competition., ② If the number of people subject to grading for the final task for each occupation at a local competition is 4 or more, and the occupation falls under 4 cities/provinces, the president may select that occupation. A warning notice is issued, and occupations that have received warning notices three times within five years are automatically abolished after two national competitions are held. However, it only applies if it is adopted as a formal occupation. Revised April 9, 2019, January 8, 2021, ③ Notwithstanding paragraph 2, the abolition of occupations participating in international competitions shall be determined by the Skills Competition Deliberation Committee. At this time, paragraph 2 applies to occupations decided to be maintained after deliberation and resolution. Revised on January 8, 2021, ④ If there are any changes, such as the establishment or abolition of competition occupations, the chairman must notify the skill competition-related organizations, etc.
